title: Showers expected in several places today
byline: Showers predicted will occur at times in the Sabaragamuwa province and in the Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today (15), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Canada issues multiple heat warnings
byline: Canada’s environment authority on Monday afternoon issued multiple heat warnings for several provinces, including Ontario, Quebec and the Atlantic provinces.

title: 10 foreign nationals arrested for working while on tourist visas
byline: A total of 10 foreign nationals have been arrested for engaging in employment while entering the country on tourist visas.

title: Chaos on Delhi-Mumbai SpiceJet flight: 2 passengers try to enter cockpit
byline: Two unruly passengers were offloaded from a SpiceJet flight at the Delhi airport on Monday after they attempted to forcefully enter the cockpit when the aircraft was taxiing.

title: Injured tusker ‘Bhathiya’ dies
byline: Injured tusker ‘Bhathiya’ which was receiving treatment for several days has succumbed this morning (15).

title: Recommendations issued to increase efficiency of railway service
byline: The railway telecommunication system improvement project is currently not functioning effectively, according to the National Audit Office.

title: ‘Harry Potter’ TV series shoot begins, makers share first look
byline: Production has begun on the new TV adaptation of Harry Potter, as the first picture of the lead actor in costume was released.

title: Police seize illegally assembled jeep in Himbutana
byline: An individual has been taken into custody along with a jeep that was allegedly assembled illegally, by officers of the Police Special Task Force (STF) based at the Jayewardenepura camp.

title: Gold prices edge lower after hitting three-week high
byline: Gold prices edged lower after hitting a three-week high on Monday, with attention focused on trade talks and U.S. economic data, while silver climbed to its highest level since September 2011.

title: Youth arrested at BIA with foreign cigarettes worth Rs. 7 mn
byline: An individual has been apprehended at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by Sri Lanka Customs officers along with a consignment of foreign-manufactured cigarettes valued at Rs. 7 million.

title: Committee appointed to probe irregularities at S’gamuwa Uni
byline: A four-member independent committee has been appointed to probe alleged administrative & financial irregularities at the Sabaragamuwa University, the Ministry of Education stated.

title: ASPI surpasses 19,000 points mark for first time ever
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) reached a historic milestone today (15) as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 19,000-points mark for the first time in the capital market’s history.

title: Two persons dead after car topples into Viyana canal in Mahiyanganaya
byline: Two individuals have died after a car traveling along the Mahiyanganaya–Badulla main road toppled into the Viyana canal near the 17th milepost in Mahiyanganaya this morning, police stated.

title: Four South Eastern Uni students hospitalised following assault incident
byline: A total of four students of the Faculty of Engineering at the South Eastern University of Sri Lanka have been hospitalised following an assault incident.

title: Japan launches govt body to address concerns over foreigners
byline: Japan on Tuesday (Jul 15) set up an administrative body aimed at easing citizens’ concerns over the rapid rise in the number of foreigners in recent years, as policies concerning non-Japanese residents emerge as a key issue in Sunday’s national election.

title: Specialist neurosurgeon at J’pura Hospital granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has granted bail to Dr. Maheshi Wijeratne, a Consultant Neurosurgeon attached to the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital, who was arrested and remanded on suspicion of engaging in corrupt practices by allegedly selling surgical equipment to patients at inflated prices.

title: Police constable arrested for soliciting bribe of Rs. 3,000
byline: A police constable has been arrested for soliciting a bribe of Rs. 3,000 from an individual, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has confirmed.

title: Heavy rains pummel New York city and suburbs, flooding subway and highways
byline: Heavy rain pummeled New York City and its suburbs on Monday night, flooding parts of the subway system, inundating major roads and causing long flight delays.

title: Ex-SriLankan Airlines Chief Nishantha Wickramasinghe granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of former SriLankan Airlines Chairman Nishantha Wickramasinghe, who was arrested and remanded by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) on charges of corruption.

title: Nvidia to resume sales of AI chip to China as CEO visits Beijing
byline: Nvidia said it plans to resume sales of its H20 artificial intelligence chip to China, days after its CEO, who is visiting Beijing, met U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Opposition members stage walkout as election of Seethawaka PS chairman delayed once again
byline: The election to appoint a new chairman for the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha has been delayed once again after members of the opposition staged a walkout today.

title: Saudi Fund assures support to implement new projects in Sri Lanka
byline: A meeting between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the Saudi Fund for Development (SFD) Sultan A. Al-Marshad was held at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday (14).

title: India orders airlines to check fuel switches on Boeing jets
byline: India’s aviation regulator has ordered the country’s airlines to inspect fuel control switches in Boeing aeroplanes, after their reported involvement in a fatal Air India crash that killed 260 people in June.

title: World’s ‘oldest’ marathon runner dies at 114 in hit-and-run
byline: Fauja Singh, a British-Indian man believed to be the world’s oldest marathon runner, has died after being hit by a car in India at the age of 114.

title: SJB suspends six of its members elected to Beruwala UC
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has decided to suspend the party membership of six of its members elected to the Beruwala Urban Council at the recent Local Government (LG) election.

title: 20 Sri Lankan missions to be equipped with biometric stations to receive passport applications
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to implement a project to facilitate the expeditious obtaining of passports for Sri Lankans living in foreign countries by using digital technology.

title: ‘Strikes push postal service backwards’ – Cabinet Spokesman warns
byline: It is unacceptable that postal workers have decided to engage in trade union action despite holding several rounds of discussions, said the Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: Govt to provide temporary monitoring relief for e–commerce activities?
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a proposal to appoint a committee to recommend a temporary monitoring relief for e–commerce translations promptly, considering the rapid growth of online transactions in Sri Lanka.

title: Govt to recruit over 2,500 for nursing service to address staff shortage
byline: Two Gazette notifications are scheduled to be issued on Friday (18), to facilitate the appointment of nursing offices to fill existing vacancies, Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has announced.

title: Cabinet approves USD 100M ADB funded project to upgrade secondary hospitals
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to implement a project aimed at enhancing capacity in secondary treatment hospitals from 2025 to 2030.

title: Govt to strengthen laws against shooting of wild elephants
byline: A meeting was held today (15) at the Ministry of Environment with officials from the Department of Wildlife Conservation, aimed at tightening laws against the shooting of wild elephants.

title: Five power sets to be procured to address railway shortage
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the procurement of five power sets to be deployed for suburban and long-distance passenger services.

title: Tourist arrivals in July top 75,000
byline: A total of 79,711 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in July, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Syria announces ceasefire after sectarian violence
byline: Syria’s defence minister announced a ceasefire shortly after government forces entered a key city in Sweida province on Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka signs $15 mln MoU with STEMedical USA for accredited laboratory
byline: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed this morning (15) at the Presidential Secretariat between STEMedical of the USA and the Sri Lanka Institute of Biotechnology (SLIBTEC) to establish a laboratory with internationally recognised accreditation, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Tangalle Sub-Inspector produced before court over sexual assault allegations
byline: The Sub-Inspector (SI) of the Tangalle Police, who was arrested on charges of sexually assaulting and threatening a female police officer from the same police station, was produced before the Tangalle Magistrate’s Court today (15).

title: SJB secures power in Seethawakapura UC
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has secured power in the Seethawakapura Urban Council, where the opposition held a majority in the 2025 Local Government Elections.

title: Youth arrested with smuggled gold worth over Rs. 1 billion at BIA
byline: A 32-year-old Sri Lankan passenger has been arrested at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) upon arrival from Dubai for attempting to smuggle 35 kg of gold into the country, according to the Ada Derana reporter.

title: HRCSL reaffirms state institutions’ legal duty to follow its recommendations
byline: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) has issued an official statement to all heads of state institutions, reaffirming their legal obligation to implement the commission’s recommendations following its investigations.

title: TV Derana wins best documentary at Sumathi Awards 2024
byline: TV Derana’s ‘Missaka Pawwa’ programme has won the award for Best Documentary Programme at the Sumathi Awards 2024.

title: Foreign remittances expected to reach US$ 7 billion by year-end
byline: During the first six months of 2025 (January to June), a total of 144,379 Sri Lankan migrant workers departed the country for overseas employment, according to the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE).

title: Sri Lankan delegation to visit US this week for tariff talks
byline: A Sri Lankan government delegation is scheduled to leave for the United States on Friday (July 18) to negotiate a reduction in the tariffs imposed on Sri Lankan exports to the US, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said.

title: Netanyahu under mounting political pressure after party quits
byline: A religious party has quit Israel’s ruling coalition in a dispute over military service, leaving Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu with a razor-thin majority in parliament but still enough political support to secure a potential Gaza ceasefire.

title: TV Derana wins top honors at Sumathi Awards 2025
byline: TV Derana’s ‘Missaka Pawwa’ programme has won the award for Best Documentary Programme at the Sumathi Awards 2025.
